author: protolambda
content: <@557201004060213248> if you believe it was not simply a fork version configuration error or something else, yes that would help.

author: protolambda
content: Also, I'm working on an eth1 data and deposit tracker, to see these things live as they happen, so we can respond to them earlier

author: nishant0
content: Tried syncing a fresh prysm node, however I am getting a lot of duplicated blocks. Sometimes my set of peers return the same block 3-4 times. Will try and dig some more to see which client its from

author: protolambda
content:
The identify libp2p component helps to narrow it down to which libp2p language stack is being used, at which point it's pretty obvious which client type. <@476250636548308992> 
Maybe we want to disable it some time in the future, something to discuss later

content: nice, thanks for the tip, will try it out with this
